title: 1 John Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 John chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 John Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 John Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:2, how can you know the Spirit of God?
options: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh
Every spirit that speaks in tongues
Every spirit that heals the sick
Every spirit that performs miracles
questions.correctAnswer: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:2 states that the Spirit of God is known by every spirit that confesses Jesus Christ has come in the flesh.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4:3 say about every spirit that does not confess Jesus Christ came in the flesh?
options: It is not of God and is the spirit of antichrist
It is an angel of God
It is a spirit of truth
It is a spirit of prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: It is not of God and is the spirit of antichrist
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:3 explains that any spirit that does not confess Jesus came in the flesh is not from God and is the spirit of antichrist.

questions.question: Who is greater than he that is in the world, according to 1 John 4:4?
options: He that is in you
The false prophets
The spirit of error
The antichrist
questions.correctAnswer: He that is in you
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:4 states that greater is he that is in you (God's Spirit) than he that is in the world.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:7, why should we love one another?
options: Because love is of God
Because it is commanded by man
Because it brings prosperity
Because it earns favor
questions.correctAnswer: Because love is of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:7 says we should love one another because love originates from God.

questions.question: What is God described as in 1 John 4:8?
options: Love
Light
Peace
Justice
questions.correctAnswer: Love
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:8 explicitly states that God is love.

questions.question: What manifestation of God's love is described in 1 John 4:9?
options: God sent his only begotten Son into the world
God gave the law to Moses
God created the heavens and the earth
God sent angels to protect us
questions.correctAnswer: God sent his only begotten Son into the world
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:9 explains that God's love was manifested by sending His only begotten Son into the world.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:11, what ought we to do if God loved us so much?
options: Love one another
Pray without ceasing
Give offerings
Attend the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Love one another
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:11 instructs that we ought to love one another if God so loved us.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4:12 say about seeing God and loving one another?
options: No man hath seen God at any time, but if we love one another, God dwelleth in us
Many have seen God and loved their neighbor
We can only love God if we see Him
Loving one another is not necessary to see God
questions.correctAnswer: No man hath seen God at any time, but if we love one another, God dwelleth in us
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:12 states that no one has seen God, but loving one another means God dwells in us and His love is perfected.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:14, who sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world?
options: The Father
The angels
Moses
The apostles
questions.correctAnswer: The Father
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:14 testifies that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.

questions.question: What happens to whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, according to 1 John 4:15?
options: God dwelleth in him, and he in God
They will be given wealth
They will perform miracles
They will never face trials
questions.correctAnswer: God dwelleth in him, and he in God
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:15 says that whoever confesses Jesus as the Son of God has God dwelling in him and he in God.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 4:18 says there is fear in love.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:18 states that there is no fear in love; perfect love casts out fear.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 4:19 says we love Him because He first loved us.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:19 clearly states that we love God because He first loved us.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 4:20, if a man says he loves God but hates his brother, he is telling the truth.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:20 says that if a man says he loves God but hates his brother, he is a liar.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 John 4:1: 'Beloved, believe not every ______, but try the spirits whether they are of God.'
options: spirit
word
man
prophet
questions.correctAnswer: spirit
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:1 instructs us not to believe every spirit but to test them to see if they are from God.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 John 4:21: 'And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his ______ also.'
options: brother
neighbor
country
friend
questions.correctAnswer: brother
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:21 commands that whoever loves God must also love his brother.

medium.title: 1 John Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 John Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is confused by many teachings. Based on 1 John 4, how can they discern if a spirit is from God?
options: By seeing if the spirit confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
By how popular the teaching is in the church
By whether the teaching feels comforting
By observing how many miracles the spirit performs
questions.correctAnswer: By seeing if the spirit confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:2-3 instruct believers to know the Spirit of God by whether it confesses Jesus Christ has come in the flesh, distinguishing true spirits from false ones.

questions.question: When facing opposition from false teachers, what encouragement does 1 John 4 give about God's presence in believers?
options: Greater is He that is in you, than he that is in the world
You should avoid all contact with the world
You must perform miracles to prove your faith
You should isolate yourself from others
questions.correctAnswer: Greater is He that is in you, than he that is in the world
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:4 encourages believers by reminding them that God who dwells in them is greater than any worldly opposition or spirit.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4, what is the source of love, and what does it indicate about a person who loves?
options: Love is of God; everyone who loves is born of God and knows God
Love is a human emotion; loving shows good character
Love comes from family upbringing; loving indicates good manners
Love is a social contract; loving means fitting in with society
questions.correctAnswer: Love is of God; everyone who loves is born of God and knows God
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:7 explains that love originates from God, and those who love demonstrate they are born of God and have a relationship with Him.

questions.question: How does 1 John 4 describe God's nature in relation to love?
options: God is love
God is justice
God is power
God is knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: God is love
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:8 clearly states that God is love, emphasizing that love is an essential attribute of God’s nature.

questions.question: What example of God’s love toward us is given in 1 John 4 that believers can rely on?
options: God sent His only begotten Son into the world so that we might live through Him
God gave us the law to follow perfectly
God blessed us with wealth and health
God sent angels to protect us
questions.correctAnswer: God sent His only begotten Son into the world so that we might live through Him
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:9 explains that God’s love was manifested by sending His Son, Jesus Christ, to give us life, showing the ultimate expression of love.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4 teach about our response to God’s love?
options: If God loved us, we ought also to love one another
We should only love those who love us back
Love is optional since God’s love is enough
We should focus on loving God first, then people later
questions.correctAnswer: If God loved us, we ought also to love one another
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:11 commands believers to love one another because God first loved us, making love a necessary response to God’s love.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4, how is God’s love perfected in us?
options: When we love one another
When we attend church regularly
When we fast and pray often
When we give generously
questions.correctAnswer: When we love one another
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:12 teaches that God dwells in us and His love is perfected when we practice love toward one another.

questions.question: What assurance does 1 John 4 give about dwelling in God?
options: We know we dwell in Him because He has given us His Spirit
We dwell in Him if we follow all the laws perfectly
We dwell in Him by avoiding worldly pleasures
We dwell in Him only if we never sin
questions.correctAnswer: We know we dwell in Him because He has given us His Spirit
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:13 confirms that the presence of God’s Spirit in believers is the evidence of mutual indwelling between God and His people.

questions.question: How does 1 John 4 instruct believers to confess Jesus Christ?
options: By confessing that Jesus is the Son of God
By confessing only in private prayer
By confessing that Jesus was a great prophet
By confessing that Jesus is a moral teacher
questions.correctAnswer: By confessing that Jesus is the Son of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:15 states that whoever confesses Jesus as the Son of God has God dwelling in him and he in God, highlighting the importance of this confession.

questions.question: What is the relationship between love and fear according to 1 John 4?
options: Perfect love casts out fear
Love and fear can coexist
Fear proves that love is strong
Fear is necessary to maintain love
questions.correctAnswer: Perfect love casts out fear
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:18 teaches that there is no fear in love; perfect love drives out fear because fear involves torment and is not compatible with perfect love.

questions.question: A believer claims to love God but hates his brother. Based on 1 John 4, what biblical truth would you share?
options: He is a liar, because one cannot love God and hate a brother
He is sincere but mistaken
He should focus on loving God more deeply
Hating a brother is acceptable if the brother has faults
questions.correctAnswer: He is a liar, because one cannot love God and hate a brother
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:20 teaches that anyone who claims to love God but hates a brother is lying, emphasizing the inseparable link between love for God and love for others.

questions.question: How does 1 John 4 describe the commandment from God regarding love?
options: He who loves God must love his brother also
Love God first, then love your neighbor sometimes
Love is optional for those who follow the law
Love is only commanded for the family
questions.correctAnswer: He who loves God must love his brother also
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:21 clarifies that the commandment from God is that those who love Him should also love their brothers, linking love for God with love for others.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 John 4, the spirit of antichrist denies that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:3 states that every spirit that does not confess Jesus Christ coming in the flesh is not of God and is the spirit of antichrist.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 4 teaches that knowing God means hearing and accepting the message of the apostles.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:6 explains that those who know God listen to the apostles' message, distinguishing the spirit of truth from error.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "There is no _____ in love; but perfect love casteth out _____."
options: fear, fear
doubt, fear
fear, sin
doubt, sin
questions.correctAnswer: fear, fear
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:18 teaches that there is no fear in love; perfect love casts out fear, emphasizing love’s power to remove fear.

hard.title: 1 John Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 John Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4, what is the primary test to discern if a spirit is from God?
options: Confessing that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
Performing miracles and signs
Preaching peace and prosperity
Proclaiming the law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Confessing that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:2-3 states that the Spirit of God is known by confessing that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh, distinguishing true spirits from the spirit of antichrist.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world' in the context of spiritual warfare?
options: It emphasizes the believer’s victory over false spirits through God's indwelling presence
It highlights human strength over evil
It refers to the political power of the early church
It suggests that the physical world is superior to spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the believer’s victory over false spirits through God's indwelling presence
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:4 explains that believers overcome false spirits because God, who dwells in them, is greater than any spirit in the world, reflecting the theme of divine empowerment over evil.

questions.question: What literary device is used in 1 John 4:7-8 where love is linked directly to God’s nature?
options: Parallelism
Chiasmus
Typology
Allegory
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: Verses 7-8 use parallelism by repeating the concept that love is from God and that God is love, reinforcing the inseparable relationship between God and love.

questions.question: Which Old Testament concept does the sending of God’s only begotten Son as propitiation for sins (1 John 4:10) most directly connect to?
options: The sacrificial system and the Day of Atonement
The covenant with Abraham
The building of the Temple
The giving of the Ten Commandments
questions.correctAnswer: The sacrificial system and the Day of Atonement
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:10’s mention of propitiation connects to the Old Testament sacrificial system, especially the Day of Atonement, where sacrifice was made for sin to restore God’s favor.

questions.question: How does 1 John 4:12 develop the theme of God’s invisibility in relation to His presence among believers?
options: God dwells in believers through love, perfecting His presence despite being unseen
God can only be seen in the Temple
Believers see God directly through visions
God is visible only to the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: God dwells in believers through love, perfecting His presence despite being unseen
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:12 acknowledges that no one has seen God, but by loving one another, God dwells in believers and His love is perfected among them, emphasizing relational presence over physical sight.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'God is love' in 1 John 4:8 and 16 in the context of Johannine theology?
options: It identifies God’s very nature as love, foundational for Christian ethics and community
It limits God’s attributes only to love
It refers to God’s love for Israel exclusively
It is a poetic metaphor with no doctrinal weight
questions.correctAnswer: It identifies God’s very nature as love, foundational for Christian ethics and community
questions.explanation: In Johannine theology, particularly 1 John 4:8,16, 'God is love' reveals love as the essence of God’s being, which undergirds Christian life and ethical demands to love others.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:15, what is the spiritual result of confessing that Jesus is the Son of God?
options: God dwells in the confessor and they dwell in God
The confessor gains worldly power
The confessor becomes a prophet
The confessor is exempt from trials
questions.correctAnswer: God dwells in the confessor and they dwell in God
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:15 states that confessing Jesus as the Son of God results in mutual indwelling between God and the believer, a profound spiritual union.

questions.question: In 1 John 4:18, what theological concept is illustrated by stating 'perfect love casteth out fear'?
options: The transformative power of divine love to overcome judgment anxiety
The eradication of all human emotions
The elimination of sin through fearlessness
The promise of physical safety
questions.correctAnswer: The transformative power of divine love to overcome judgment anxiety
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:18 connects perfect love with freedom from fear, particularly fear related to judgment, highlighting love’s power to give believers boldness and assurance.

questions.question: What is the ethical implication of 1 John 4:20 regarding love for God and love for one’s brother?
options: Claiming to love God while hating one’s brother is hypocrisy
Love for God overrides social relationships
Hating a brother is acceptable if one loves God
Love for God is unrelated to love for neighbors
questions.correctAnswer: Claiming to love God while hating one’s brother is hypocrisy
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:20 teaches that genuine love for God is inseparable from love for one’s brother, condemning any claim to love God that coexists with hatred towards others.

questions.question: How does 1 John 4:14 serve as a Christological witness within the epistle?
options: It testifies that the Father sent the Son to be the Savior of the world
It denies the divinity of Jesus
It focuses on Jesus as a moral teacher only
It emphasizes the Son as an angelic messenger
questions.correctAnswer: It testifies that the Father sent the Son to be the Savior of the world
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:14 explicitly affirms the sending of Jesus by the Father for salvation, reinforcing the core Christological confession of the epistle.

questions.question: True or False: 1 John 4 teaches that perfect love completely removes all fear from a believer’s life.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:18 states that perfect love casts out fear related to judgment, but does not claim that all fear (e.g., natural caution) is removed.

questions.question: Which Greek term for 'propitiation' used in 1 John 4:10 connects to the Old Testament concept of atonement?
options: Hilasterion
Logos
Agape
Pistis
questions.correctAnswer: Hilasterion
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'hilasterion' in 1 John 4:10 is used for 'propitiation' and links to the idea of atonement and mercy seat in the Old Testament, highlighting Jesus' sacrificial role.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4:13 reveal about the relationship between the Spirit and the believer’s assurance of dwelling in God?
options: The Spirit given by God confirms that we dwell in Him and He in us
The Spirit is only a metaphor for God's presence
The Spirit is received only at baptism
The Spirit replaces the need for faith
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit given by God confirms that we dwell in Him and He in us
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:13 emphasizes that the indwelling of the Spirit is the evidence and assurance of the reciprocal relationship between God and the believer.

questions.question: How does 1 John 4:21 extend the commandment found in the Shema (Deuteronomy 6:5) to the New Testament context?
options: It commands that loving God must be expressed by loving one’s brother
It focuses exclusively on love for God with no mention of neighbors
It replaces the Shema with a new law
It emphasizes ritual sacrifices over love
questions.correctAnswer: It commands that loving God must be expressed by loving one’s brother
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:21 builds on the Shema’s call to love God by adding the necessity of loving one's brother, embodying the New Testament ethic of neighborly love as inseparable from divine love.

questions.question: In the cultural and historical context of 1 John, why does the author emphasize testing spirits and discerning truth from error (1 John 4:1,6)?
options: Because early Christian communities faced false teachings and antichrists infiltrating the church
Because the Roman Empire mandated spiritual tests
Because the apostles were no longer present to teach
Because of Jewish legalism dominating the churches
questions.correctAnswer: Because early Christian communities faced false teachings and antichrists infiltrating the church
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:1,6 reflects the historical reality of false prophets and antichrists threatening early Christian doctrine, prompting believers to discern true spirits from false.

theological.title: 1 John Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 John Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4, how can one discern whether a spirit is from God?
options: By confessing that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
By signs and wonders performed
By the spirit's eloquence
By the spirit's popularity among believers
questions.correctAnswer: By confessing that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:2-3 teaches that the true Spirit of God confesses Jesus Christ coming in the flesh, distinguishing it from the spirit of antichrist. This aligns with doctrinal affirmations found in Isaiah 7:14 and John 1:14 about the incarnation.

questions.question: What is identified as the spirit of antichrist in 1 John 4?
options: The spirit that denies Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
The spirit that denies the resurrection
The spirit that denies the Trinity
The spirit that denies the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit that denies Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:3 identifies the spirit that denies Jesus Christ's incarnation as the spirit of antichrist, consistent with the New Testament warnings against false teaching (2 John 1:7, 2 Thessalonians 2:3).

questions.question: What assurance does 1 John 4:4 give to believers regarding their victory over false spirits?
options: Greater is He that is in you than he that is in the world
More knowledge leads to victory
Numbers and strength overcome opposition
Wisdom from elders ensures victory
questions.correctAnswer: Greater is He that is in you than he that is in the world
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:4 assures believers that God's presence within them is greater than worldly powers, resonating with Romans 8:31 and Ephesians 6:10 about God's omnipotence over evil.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:7-8, what is the fundamental nature of God?
options: God is love
God is justice
God is wrath
God is mystery
questions.correctAnswer: God is love
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:7-8 explicitly states 'God is love,' a foundational theological truth echoed in Romans 5:8, John 3:16, and 1 Corinthians 13 emphasizing God's nature revealed through Christ.

questions.question: What is the reason given in 1 John 4 for God sending His Son into the world?
options: That we might live through Him
To establish a kingdom on earth
To bring political freedom
To teach moral laws
questions.correctAnswer: That we might live through Him
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:9 affirms God's love manifested by sending His Son so that believers might have life, resonating with John 10:10 and Romans 6:23 regarding eternal life through Christ.

questions.question: In 1 John 4, what is described as the 'propitiation for our sins'?
options: Jesus Christ, the Son of God
The law of Moses
The sacrifices of the temple
The prayers of the saints
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ, the Son of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:10 states Jesus was sent as propitiation for sins, consistent with Hebrews 9:26 and Romans 3:25 which describe Christ's atoning sacrifice satisfying divine justice.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4:12 teach about the relationship between loving one another and God's presence?
options: If we love one another, God dwells in us and His love is perfected in us
Loving one another is optional for believers
God dwells only in the temple, not in believers
Love is unrelated to God's indwelling
questions.correctAnswer: If we love one another, God dwells in us and His love is perfected in us
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:12 teaches that mutual love among believers is evidence of God's indwelling and the perfection of His love, aligning with John 13:34-35 and Romans 5:5 about love as the mark of God's presence.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:13, how do believers know that they dwell in God and He in them?
options: Because He has given us of His Spirit
Because we attend church regularly
Because we follow the law perfectly
Because we perform miracles
questions.correctAnswer: Because He has given us of His Spirit
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:13 confirms that the presence of the Holy Spirit within believers is the assurance of mutual indwelling with God, consistent with John 14:17 and Romans 8:9-11 regarding the Spirit as God's seal.

questions.question: What confession does 1 John 4:15 say confirms that God dwells in a person?
options: Confessing that Jesus is the Son of God
Confessing faith in the law
Confessing past sins only
Confessing allegiance to a nation
questions.correctAnswer: Confessing that Jesus is the Son of God
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:15 explains that confessing Jesus as the Son of God is the sign of God's indwelling presence, consistent with Matthew 16:16 and Romans 10:9 on salvation confession.

questions.question: How does 1 John 4:16 describe the relationship between love and God’s indwelling?
options: He who dwells in love dwells in God, and God in him
Love and God’s indwelling are unrelated
Only perfect people can dwell in God
God dwells only in the church building
questions.correctAnswer: He who dwells in love dwells in God, and God in him
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:16 highlights that abiding in love is synonymous with abiding in God, echoing Galatians 5:22-23 and John 15:9-10 about love as the evidence of fellowship with God.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4:17 say is perfected in believers allowing boldness on the day of judgment?
options: Our love
Our knowledge
Our works
Our faith
questions.correctAnswer: Our love
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:17 teaches that perfected love in believers grants confidence at judgment, consistent with 1 Corinthians 13:8 and Hebrews 10:22 concerning love’s role in sanctification and assurance.

questions.question: According to 1 John 4:18, what is cast out by perfect love?
options: Fear
Doubt
Sorrow
Unbelief
questions.correctAnswer: Fear
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:18 declares that perfect love casts out fear, reflecting Isaiah 41:10 and 2 Timothy 1:7 where God’s love removes fear and gives power, love, and self-discipline.

questions.question: What motivation for love does 1 John 4:19 provide?
options: We love Him because He first loved us
We love Him to earn salvation
We love Him to gain earthly rewards
We love Him because love is easy
questions.correctAnswer: We love Him because He first loved us
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:19 states the foundational motivation for Christian love is God's prior love for us, as also taught in John 15:9-10 and Romans 5:8 emphasizing grace before response.

questions.question: What does 1 John 4:20 say about claiming to love God while hating a brother?
options: He is a liar because love for God requires love for brother
He is sincere but confused
He is excused due to difficult circumstances
He is more spiritual than others
questions.correctAnswer: He is a liar because love for God requires love for brother
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:20 teaches that hating a brother contradicts true love for God, echoed in Matthew 22:37-40 and James 2:8 where love of neighbor fulfills God’s commandments.

questions.question: What commandment concerning love does 1 John 4:21 give from God?
options: Whoever loves God must also love his brother
Love only God and ignore others
Love is optional for believers
Love is only for family members
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever loves God must also love his brother
questions.explanation: 1 John 4:21 commands believers to love their brothers as an inseparable aspect of loving God, consistent with Leviticus 19:18, John 13:34, and Romans 13:8 affirming love’s primacy in the law.
